comments.value:
I am having real difficulties adding our new Tier 3 sponsor, John Lewis, to the Sponsors page. It looks horrible in IE7 and horrible in FF3. See the grab below. Please could you add John Lewis in for me in alphabetical order i.e. after Holiday Inn? The link should go to http://www.johnlewis.com/ Even more importantly, can you look at making this page display properly so we can edit it ourselves? Thank you Morag Reavley New Media Manager London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games 23rd Floor, One Churchill Place London E14 5LN Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 160 Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000 www.london2012.com www.twitter.com/london2012 www.youtube.com/london2012
This email message has been scanned for viruses by Mimecast. Mimecast delivers a complete managed email solution from a single web based platform. For more information please visit http://www.mimecast.com

I wonder if it makes more sense for us to split the sponsors out so they have a page of their own (that is never linked to / is pretty much unbranded) and then pull them back into the sponsors page in the correct tier *and* in alphabetical order.

Would save the need to re-juggle to boxes round each time.

I am assuming here that I can just get as many boxes/logos as needed to float which might not be possible. But thought I'd run the above idea past you first before I investigate further.

That sounds perfect to me in the long term - having to juggle around
logos etc is a pain. So yes, please investigate.

 

In the short term though would be really good to get the John Lewis link
up today if that's possible.

 

Thank you!

 

________________________________

Done.
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/about-us/the-people-delivering-the-games/international-and-uk-partners/index.php

comments.value:
2) To convert latest events to related events we'll need to do the same as above, for:

News article
Generic hub
Sports hub
Subhub
Event
Supplier

* once again all these templates/pages need to show related news/blogs or do some just want to still show just the latest?

## IMPORTANT NOTE ## 
Events are slightly different from news/blogs in that they are possibly even more timely, in order that 'related' past events don't show we'd need to republish all pages using te above templates everyday which isn't practical.

If we think that out of dates events isn't practical / desirable we may be better closing this ticket and looking back at the previous caching suggestions.

thanks

Jamie
I think we may want to keep these as latest, for the time being at least.  Let's hold off on this for a bit.
Cancelled.

subject: Convert latest events to related events (on the following templates)
description:
2) To convert latest events to related events we'll need to do the same as above, for:

News article
Generic hub
Sports hub
Subhub
Event
Supplier

* once again all these templates/pages need to show related news/blogs or do some just want to still show just the latest?

## IMPORTANT NOTE ## 
Events are slightly different from news/blogs in that they are possibly even more timely, in order that 'related' past events don't show we'd need to republish all pages using te above templates everyday which isn't practical.

If we think that out of dates events isn't practical / desirable we may be better closing this ticket and looking back at the previous caching suggestions.

thanks

Jamie

comments.value:
I was just randomly playing with the related photos box on the venues page http://www.london2012.com/games/venues/index.php

See the two attached screen grabs.  Screen grab 1 is when I arrive at the page - everything is fine.  Screen grab 2 is after I scroll forward to picture 3 of 9, and then back to picture 1 again.  When you hit the arrow to scroll back through the related pics, the pictures collate below one another, and you end up with an additional Related Pictures box for every time you clicked backwards

Ticket #466 "Related photos bug" was closed and merged into this ticket. Last Comment in #466: Hi Bug on page with related images.... if you scroll through them and then go back three extra 'related photos' boxes appeared underneath... Alex Alexandra Brown Marketing Executive (New Media) Communications Olympic Delivery Authority Mailpoint: 7A 23rd Floor, One Churchill Place London E14 5LN Direct line: +44 (0) 203 023 6016 Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000 Fax: +44 (0) 203 2012 001 www.london2012.com Find out what is going on at London 2012 HQ - http://blog.london2012.com

description:
I was just randomly playing with the related photos box on the venues page http://www.london2012.com/games/venues/index.php

See the two attached screen grabs.  Screen grab 1 is when I arrive at the page - everything is fine.  Screen grab 2 is after I scroll forward to picture 3 of 9, and then back to picture 1 again. comments.value:
Photos are related (except a stray one which I'll remove) so it's mainly video and virtual tour we need related... Thanks Alex ________________________________ From: Simon Knowles Sent: 28 January 2010 10:20 To: support@postcms.zendesk.com Cc: Alexandra Brown Subject: Related content on VeloPark page Importance: High Hi Kitsite Please could you advise how I ensure the related content on this page is more relevant? We have a virtual tour, video blog and image gallery of this venue, all of which went live today. As you may know, we have a major announcement about this venue (Alex has been developing a splash page with Jamie for this purpose), so it would be good to sort this asap - it will look rather odd at the moment for the people that land on this page. Many thanks Simon Simon Knowles Marketing Manager Communications Direct line: +44 (0)20 3023 6595 Mobile 07827 831412 Olympic Delivery Authority Mailpoint: 7a 23rd Floor, One Churchill Place London E14 5LN Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000 Fax: +44 (0) 203 2012 001 www.london2012.com Find out what is going on at London 2012 HQ - http://blog.london2012.com P Please consider the environment before printing this email
This email message has been scanned for viruses by Mimecast. Mimecast delivers a complete managed email solution from a single web based platform. For more information please visit http://www.mimecast.com

Photos / Video are purely related by tags, if you want to make sure 
they link up it may be worth adding matching free text tags to each 
page/photo/video you want to tie up ie "Velodrome Launch"
http://www.london2012.com/news/2010/01/olympic-gold-medallist-sees-velodrome-steel-structure-complete.php

At the moment it looks like it's just relating on sport=Cycling and 
venue=Velodrome
http://www.london2012.com/videos/search.php?sport=Cycling&paralympic=Cycling&venue=Velodrome&related=true

Not sure where related Virtual tours are meant to be pulled in? But 
actaully I /don't/ think we pull them in based on tags anywhere, it 
just pulls in the latest virtual tour added to the CMS (although in 
this case that should actually be the Velodrome)

comments.value:
Hi I want to make the Velodrome webcam the first one showing on the homepage. How do I do this? Jamie told me how to do it a few weeks ago, but I have tried putting '1' in the navigation order and republishing but it doesn't seem to have done anything. We could do with this changing this asap. Thanks Alex Alexandra Brown Marketing Executive (New Media) Communications Olympic Delivery Authority Mailpoint: 7A 23rd Floor, One Churchill Place London E14 5LN Direct line: +44 (0) 203 023 6016 Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000 Fax: +44 (0) 203 2012 001 www.london2012.com Find out what is going on at London 2012 HQ - http://blog.london2012.com
This email message has been scanned for viruses by Mimecast. Mimecast delivers a complete managed email solution from a single web based platform. For more information please visit http://www.mimecast.com

Hi Alex,

The each have a number under metadata 10,20,30

To make the Velodrome the first one assign it a lower number ie. 9 (so 
you can add in 8,7,6,5, 4,3,2 and 1 / we could reverse so that highest 
is first but lets pick that up later./separately after you have todays 
Velodome launch out the way)

Jamie

Thanks - that worked. We could do with fixing it/making it easier to
update and also we would want different webcams to show first on
different pages.

 

________________________________

Hi Alex, when you say "fixing it/making it easier to update" not sure what you are suggesting (honest question, do you have any suggestions / what are the main issues you'd like us to address?)

Neither Webcams or Virtual Tours are pulled in based on tagging, we can modify this but will take a small amount of new work/coding. Therefore I have opened a separate ticket for it http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/483, which will need authorization.

Jamie

comments.value:
Hi,

 

It would seem the registration confirmation page
(/settings/registration-confirmation.php) is NOT being tracked in Google
Analtyics. STILL. Please fix immediately. Also, how am I supposed to
tell if there are other pages that still aren't working???

 

 

Liz

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com  

www.twitter.com/london2012team

 

<hr width="100%">
The London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games Limited
A company registered in England and Wales with its registered office at One Churchill Place, Canary Wharf, London E14 5LN and registered number 05267819 
 
This E-mail is confidential. If you are not the addressee you may not copy, forward, disclose or use any part of it. If you have received this message in error, please delete it and all copies from your system and notify the sender immediately by return
E-mail.
 
Nothing in this message or its attachments is intended to create legal relations between us unless there is an express statement creating such relations or this message contains an authorised purchase order.
 
Internet communications cannot be guaranteed to be timely secure, error or virus-free. The sender does not accept liability for any errors or omissions.

http://www.london2012.com
<hr width="100%">

Hi Liz,

What makes you think they aren't being tracked, it looks like it is being tracked  (see attached screenshot of this weeks traffic)

The Google code is in a common footer, so if it is working on one page it should be working on all other pages (the map pages are treated slightly differently).

But agree what is odd is why the drop off from January, the pages are obviously being tracked, there are 800 hits, but it's also a huge reduction. I wonder if the new Stamen code is tracking the hits in a slightly different way. I'm currently investigating this.

All pages we're republished on Monday (there is a small chance that a page was checked out and so couldn't be republished, but would assume that is a page was checked out it was in the process of being worked on and was soon to be published/republished anyway)

Jamie

We had 2000 registrations on Tuesday. And only 15(ish) people got to
that page? I think not. Also, the numbers were WAY higher, and then
crash on the 13th of Jan. Something is wrong. I think the traffic is
so minimal as to suggest it's not actually being tracked. Could
something be wrong with the code in that page which makes the GA code
not get called.

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com  

www.twitter.com/london2012team

________________________________

We've been investigating. fwiw, that page does contain the correct code. Plus when I test registration I can see that Google Analytics is successfully pinged. So not entirely clear where the problem is.

Hi Liz,

You can use this tool to tets individual pages (the confirmation page *verifies*)
http://sitescanga.com/lite

and we currently have a full report running from this service 
http://sitescanga.com

Hi Liz,

Please see the result of the report here (this is only the first 1000 pages) have also attached the report.
http://sitescanga.com/results/945c168d65ee325065ba40c3286332d14c

Excluded as you'll see are some of the static HTML pages you have uploaded such as Greenwich, 1000 days etc.

If you'd like us to add tracking code to these pages, let me know and I'll open a separate ticket (or you can open a new one) to get us to do this (please list which static pages are still active / need tracking).

In terms of going forward with these sort of pages do you want us to prepare a short document on adding the tracking code that you can supply to 3rd parties creating static pages destined go in the CMS or on the main site? Obviously if we're implementing any pages or microsites for you we'd expect to add the analytic tags as part of the implementation. It's more the static pages like the Greenwich consultation that go up without our intervention/knowledge.

In terms of a drop off in traffic, post Mondays bulk republish, we're currently checking there are no synchronization problems across the live server. If this was the case (first indications seem to suggest it's working correctly now, maybe BT fixed a syncing issues that we we're unaware of) then that would explain why we had /some/ hits tracked but not nearly as many as would be expected (ie. only hits to web01 we're being tracked hit to web02-04 we're going un-tracked).

Jamie

I'm sorry, I really don't understand. It very clearly wasn't working
for over a week in Jan. And now it is again? Randomly? Are you sure
you didn't change something on Friday?

 

 

 

 

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com  

www.twitter.com/london2012team

________________________________

Thanks, Jamie.

 

I'll take a look at the report.

 

Morag says that she actually had put in the GA code into Greenwich - by
just taking the code produced from the server. Is there anything wrong
with that?

 

Liz

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com  

www.twitter.com/london2012team

________________________________

Hi Liz,

No harm in copy/pasting the code if you happy it works (and no reason it shouldn't)

Can I close this ticket (if I can /don't/ reply as it just reopens the ticket !!)

comments.value:
From Gianfranco: "I am sure you remember that we discussed the option for LOCOG to have a dedicated CMS, still managed by you but not shared with other clients and hosted by our sponsor BT in one of their datacentres.
 
We may have the opportunity to start getting BT to move in that direction, and we would like you to help us specifying the hardware (servers, storage…) and standard software (os, Oracle…) that would be required to do that.
 
As a worst case approximation, the specs of the current CMS and its database would be more than sufficient, even if it is designed to serve more than one client. Would you be able to share that information with us?"
I sent Gianfranco a copy of the workshop follow up.

subject: Suggested hardware and software specs for new servers
description:
From Gianfranco: "I am sure you remember that we discussed the option for LOCOG to have a dedicated CMS, still managed by you but not shared with other clients and hosted by our sponsor BT in one of their datacentres.
 
We may have the opportunity to start getting BT to move in that direction, and we would like you to help us specifying the hardware (servers, storage…) and standard software (os, Oracle…) that would be required to do that.
 
As a worst case approximation, the specs of the current CMS and its database would be more than sufficient, even if it is designed to serve more than one client. Would you be able to share that information with us?"

Add a 5 sec timer to both the 'Public funders' and 'Commercial partners' logo scroller at the bottom of the page. 
http://www.london2012.com/

Janos, 

can you let me know how long this will take once you have had a chance to investigate, we're kind of committed to doing this for them, but seeing you have the mailing list and mobile stuff to deal with, I don't want to distract you too much if this looks like it could be time consuming/tricky to get working (if that is the case will try to hold them off till you have a bit more spare capacity or get Lars to look at it).

thanks

Jamie

comments.value:
Hiya,

 

I know that we haven't re-done the open weekend form, but I think we'd
like to use this type of functionality for more people to enter events
(programmers from around the country). How easy would it be to get what
we have from last year integrated, and then I can request a few tweaks
to what fields there are?

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com <http://www.london2012.com> 

www.twitter.com/london2012team

 

<hr width="100%">
The London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games Limited
A company registered in England and Wales with its registered office at One Churchill Place, Canary Wharf, London E14 5LN and registered number 05267819

Internet communications cannot be guaranteed to be timely secure, error or virus-free. The sender does not accept liability for any errors or omissions.

http://www.london2012.com
<hr width="100%">

Liz, could you have a look at the form on the old site?

We're going to re-code it either way as the back end for the events stuff and temple design has also changed.

But because each field needs adding in several places it's not an ideal thing to keep tweaking, so a definitive list of which field you require and which fields they map to on the Event page would most useful before we do anything else.

Old form (in old CMS)
http://london2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/get-involved/open-weekend/registration-form.php

The Event form/page in the new CMS
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/pages/editform/events

Ideally we need:

- the name of the field
- the name of this field on the event page / does this field even exist (and if not should we add it as a display option?)
- the label text (ideally this stays the same on entry form, form addition interface in the CMS and on the front end form submission)
- is it required
- sub text (under main title)
- are there any other special requirements, ie. can this field only be selected if X field is filled in.

You could just list exceptions (to the old form) but given the amount of changes and tweaks we had last time we looked at this it might be better to be explicitly. The other thing to consider is do you need all this info? can we just merge some fields into one single 'notes block' ? The downside to lots of fields is they will exist on every event, which won't be an issue on the site as we can easily hide/suppress them, but they will start to clog up the back end events editor.

thanks

Jamie

so, we've nearly come up with what we'd like to do for our *non* open weekend event entry form.  The Open Weekend entry form will be coming back in the near future (Jan).  For both it will be fine to share a common back-end.  This one will be the simpler version, Open Weekend will certainly have these fields as well, but probably a few more, too. Let me know if all this makes sense!  I should be able to upload the actual fields shortly..

Alright - here is the simple form for external event entries.  We will also have one for open weekend coming in the next few days, hopefully.  So that means we'll have TWO separate places for people to submit events - a general form (this one) and an open weekend specific one (coming soon).  Let me know if you have any questions!

Can we try and put a delivery date on this one?  Would be nice to have it done in a week or so.  The Open Weekend one will need to be done by end of Jan.
I have provisionally put a completion date of Jan 31st for this.

Yes, please. If we could give ourselves the 30th, and then have a day
to spare just in case - that would be great.

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com  

www.twitter.com/london2012team
